context: Wait until ISIS releases a small swarm (maybe a hundred?) of drones near, say, La Guardia airport, each loaded with an ounce or two of explosives? They could disable every jet on the airport and cause no end of delays and costs and repair bills. They spend a few thousand dollars, they cause hundreds of millions in costs. A very economic way to wage war.

context:
For people saying drones can not bring down an airliner ... all a drone has to do is carry a 1/2"W x 1/4"thick tungsten rod (or other hard material) 12-24" long and fly into the engine and that would probably be enough to cause terminal failure of that engine. This would be most effective when a 485 ton plane is taking off overloaded to where it can not land safely until it burns off fuel.

Drones are a real threat to airports.
